utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, I've I've just been. I've been sneezing a lot and I have this runny nose. It's just been very irritating. I kind of want to do something about it. I've had it for awhile, but it's just. You know, I decided to like, come in to find out what's. What's wrong with me? Why do I like? Why does this happen to me? All my friends are OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh yeah, I know it must be very, very irritating. How long has it been going on for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been years, I don't even remember.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh years, OK and years like just sneezing and the runny nose has been going on for the last few years.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it kind of kind of comes on like around the spring time. It just gets really bad at that time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: yeah? OK, and are there any besides during the spring time, any kind of allergens or any anything in the house or around you that triggers it, like dust or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, dust makes it a lot worse. Like when I have to vacuum the house, I just feel awful for the next two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, do you get any other symptoms besides the, uh, sneezing and runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, let my nose so stuffy and sometimes it's just like my eyes and my nose are just itchy and my eyes get like red and teary sometimes. It's so embarrassing when I'm going to school. I also wake up in the morning with this like sore throat and have just cough and clear out my, you know clear my throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and does that happen like every morning?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's usually worse around springtime.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. and are you coughing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, I have to like cough to clear my throat but then not otherwise.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you bringing up any sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that yeah I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Like, uh, how much would you say? Do you just bring it up in the morning, or like throughout the day,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: just in the morning,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: just in the morning?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have a sensation of like anything kind of dripping down your throat like after you wake up like just a build up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok. And besides that, have you been having any symptoms of fevers, chills, sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I get a bit of a sore throat, I guess in the morning, but it just goes away after.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But no fevers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there anything that you've tried at all, like medications or anything that has helped you with these symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm yeah, I tried like umm Reactin and that really helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That helped OK that's good and are you taking Reactin right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I didn't take it today. I tried it a couple days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you traveled at all recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, and any sick contacts, anyone around you that has been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any kind of fatigue or tiredness throughout the day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do feel more fatigued when I have these symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any night sweats, fevers, or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your bowel movements at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any trouble urinating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes to your appetite or weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been losing weight, but I've been dieting and working out more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much weight would you say you've lost over the last few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've lost about four pounds in the past four, five months. It's been hard to lose weight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so no, no sudden like loss of weight or anything like that right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well, it's really great that you're, you know, trying to lose weight and dieting and and having like a healthier lifestyle. It is definitely harder with the pandemic going on right now to to get in the activities. And it's hard like being at home, and sometimes it's really difficult to like not eat right

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah true.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So besides besides that any kind of recent exposures to any fumes, dust, animals, pets like anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it was kind of like vacuuming a couple of days ago when it got really bad, but nothing. Not not. I don't think there's not been any other exposures.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you have any past medical conditions that you have been diagnosed with like asthma, eczema, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't been diagnosed with anything. No. I did have like I know that I would sometimes get kind of short of breath as a child. But my mom doesn't really trust doctors, so she wouldn't take me to one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had shortness of breath after that, like when like as a child, how old were you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I must have been like 8 years old or 9 years old that I remember, but I think I've had it before that as well as my mom tells me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh OK, do you have that at all now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK Have you ever seen an allergist before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. Do you have any known allergies to any medications? Yeah any medication?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: no. Do you take any medications at all on a regular basis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Have you been hospitalized or had any surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any family history of any asthma, eczema, allergic rhinitis. Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think it kind of runs in my family like everyone in my family is just kind of always having this runny nose and sneezing. My mom has it. My younger brother has it. But like we haven't really been diagnosed with anything like we, we rarely go to the doctor.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and currently right now, do you work at all? Or sorry, do you go to school?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do I do. I've been doing it virtually.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Virtually OK, so have you noticed anyone sick around you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. And what at home? What's your living situation like? Who do you live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with my mom, dad and my younger brother.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, yeah, I just want to let you know that any questions I ask you today and anything we talked about it's completely confidential and unless like there is any potential harm to yourself or anyone anyone else. So yeah, I'm just gonna ask you a few questions. Do you feel safe at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you drink alcohol at all? Or have you tried alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you tried any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about smoking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm no

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: no OK, and are you sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. And so overall, do you feel safe in your home and as well as outside of your home environment? Any kind of bullying or anything like that going on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright. Yeah, so those are kind of all the questions that I had for you. Sorry just one more question, any loss of sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's hard to smell and my nose is stuffy, but no loss of taste.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. OK, so do you have any questions at all for me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I just I I just wanna get some medications to help with this. I'm just sick and tired of my runny nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, it must be very frustrating. So you've tried Reactin before, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: yeah

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so one method is to definitely like stay away from some of those allergens that are potentially causing your symptoms. But I I do really think so you might have something called like allergic rhinitis. And I think it might be beneficial to for you to see like an allergist

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so I can refer you to someone as well. Just have a sense of what kind of things allergic to you and like what medications you would require. In the meantime, definitely like any antihistamine medications would help with your symptoms. But since you're also having congestion and sneezing, just just in case, we will just do a COVID swab test for you today. And it takes around 24 to 48 hours to come back. And in the meantime, you should just isolate as much as you can in your own home. And then based on the result they would give you more instruction.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
